column5: Well, I have a big tournament on Great Sacandaga Lake in New York in mid-July, and seeing as their bass season officially opened on Saturday, we had to make a trip down.  The lakes is situated in the Adironack Mountain range about a 7 hour drive from Toronto.  We launched at about 5:20 and headed out to fish blindly, must have been alright because I had a fish in 5 minutes.  Ended up landing 23 keepers (12 inches +) today and might have had about 11 pounds for our biggest 5 fish.  We watched two local weigh-ins from other club tournaments, and to our surprise on 10.10 pounds won the first and 11.2 won the second.  Apparently 12 or 13 pounds is BIG weight for this lake as it is better known for numbers than size.  Big fish for the weekend that we saw was 2-14, I had a 2-11.  Sunday was slow as a big front had come through but in 5 hours, we managed 11 keepers for about 9 pounds.  Then reality hit and we had to come home.  Would have posted sooner, but I have not been feeling well.                          Good Fishin'
Good catch Steve, that w-eye is as thin as a pool cue but nice smallies
very nice report, some nice smallies.
Steve you are one young luck fella.Nice report and I got something to share with this shot,,,,,,,,,,,    and here LOL

Great report Steve, thanks.  Brian, I see by your seat the you're left handed.

Awesome report!!!!!!!!!   well done steve,man they are some real nice looking smallies,it also looks like a very structured lake,they also have a nice dark color on them.  ..well i hope you marked those spots on your GPS,for your tournament in july,thanks for sharing man....cheers
